results.adx_keywords: your-feed-visual-investigations;Police Brutality, Misconduct and Shootings;Police;Nichols, Tyre (d 2023);Police Department (Memphis, Tenn)
results.byline: By Robin Stein, Alexander Cardia and Natalie Reneau
results.title: 71 Commands in 13 Minutes: Officers Gave Tyre Nichols Impossible Orders
results.abstract: A Times analysis found that officers gave dozens of contradictory and unachievable orders to Mr. Nichols. The punishment was severe — and eventually fatal.

results.adx_keywords: District Attorneys;Presidential Election of 2016;Ethics and Official Misconduct;Pornography;Bragg, Alvin;Clifford, Stephanie (1979- );Cohen, Michael D (1966- );Trump, Donald J;Weisselberg, Allen;National Enquirer;Manhattan (NYC)
results.byline: By William K. Rashbaum, Ben Protess, Jonah E. Bromwich and Hurubie Meko
results.title: Manhattan Prosecutors Begin Presenting Trump Case to Grand Jury
results.abstract: The Manhattan district attorney’s decision represents a dramatic escalation of the inquiry, and potentially sets the case on a path toward criminal charges against the former president.

media.caption: The move by the district attorney, Alvin L. Bragg, compounded Donald Trump’s legal woes in the early days of his third presidential campaign.
media.copyright: John Tully for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Television;Deaths (Obituaries);Actors and Actresses;Cassar, Jon (1958- );Wersching, Annie (1977-2023)
results.title: Annie Wersching, Who Played Borg Queen on ‘Star Trek: Picard,’ Dies at 45
results.abstract: Ms. Wersching was best known for playing the Borg Queen on the Paramount+ “Star Trek” series. She was also on the television series “24,” “Bosch” and “Timeless.”

media.caption: Annie Wersching in Los Angeles in 2020.

results.adx_keywords: Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Police;Police Brutality, Misconduct and Shootings;Nichols, Tyre (d 2023);Police Department (Memphis, Tenn);Memphis (Tenn)
results.byline: By Jessica Jaglois and Rick Rojas
results.title: Two More Memphis Police Officers Are Suspended in Tyre Nichols’s Death
results.abstract: One officer, Preston Hemphill, used a stun gun that hit Mr. Nichols in the torso, according to a police report on the incident.

media.caption: Protesters in Memphis on Saturday, after video was released of police officers beating Tyre Nichols, who later died.

results.adx_keywords: Deaths (Obituaries);Comedy and Humor;Actors and Actresses;Television;Movies;Theater;Marshall, Penny;Williams, Cindy;Los Angeles (Calif);Milwaukee (Wis)
results.byline: By Matt Stevens, Livia Albeck-Ripka and Jennifer Vineyard
results.title: Cindy Williams, Star of ‘Laverne & Shirley,’ Dies at 75
results.abstract: The show, in which Ms. Williams and Penny Marshall played roommates who worked in a Milwaukee brewery, was a spinoff of “Happy Days” and became a staple of 1970s television.

media.caption: Penny Marshall, left, and Cindy Williams from “Laverne & Shirley” at the Emmy Awards in Los Angeles in 1979.

results.adx_keywords: Mercenaries and Private Military Contractors;Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);Prisons and Prisoners;Draft and Recruitment (Military);Human Rights and Human Rights Violations;Criminal Justice;Prigozhin, Yevgeny V;Putin, Vladimir V;Wagner Group;Bakhmut (Ukraine);Russia;Ukraine
results.byline: By Anatoly Kurmanaev, Alina Lobzina and Ekaterina Bodyagina
results.title: Russia Freed Prisoners to Fight Its War. Here’s How Some Fared.
results.abstract: Tens of thousands of inmates have joined a mercenary group fighting with the Kremlin’s decimated forces in Ukraine. Some of them are returning to civilian life with military training and, in many cases, battlefield traumas.
des_facet: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations

media.caption: A poster showing a member of the Russian military near the headquarters of the Wagner private military company in St. Petersburg, Russia.

results.adx_keywords: Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);United States Politics and Government;Biden, Joseph R Jr
results.byline: By Sharon LaFraniere and Noah Weiland
results.title: U.S. Plans to End Public Health Emergency for Covid in May
results.abstract: The end of the emergency, planned for May 11, will bring about a complex set of policy changes and signals a new chapter in the government’s pandemic response.

media.caption: The White House said that the nation needed an orderly transition out of the public health emergency, which has been in effect for all of President Biden’s time in office.

results.adx_keywords: Television
results.title: ‘The Last of Us’ Season 1, Episode 3 Recap: One More Good Day
results.abstract: This week’s episode, starring Nick Offerman and Murray Bartlett, stepped away from the main action, offering a melancholy vignette about companionship.

media.caption: Nick Offerman, left, and Murray Bartlett in “The Last of Us.”

results.adx_keywords: Exercise;Muscles;Heart;Content Type: Service;Habits and Routines (Behavior);Athletics and Sports;internal-sub-only
results.title: How Long Does It Take to Get Fit Again?
results.abstract: We all stray from exercise sometimes. Here’s how your body will bounce back.

media.copyright: Melissa Schriek for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Elderly;Age, Chronological;Content Type: Service;Longevity;Memory;internal-sub-only-nl
results.title: 3 Steps to Age Exuberantly
results.abstract: An 86-year-old author has a few rules to live by even when the trials of getting older make it easy to complain.

results.title: Bill Barr’s Image Rehab Is Kaput
results.abstract: The Durham investigation was a failed attempt by Mr. Barr to rewrite the sour truths of Donald Trump’s history.
des_facet: Russian Interference in 2016 US Elections and Ties to Trump Associates

results.title: Senior Housing That Seniors Actually Like
results.abstract: “Granny flats” are popping up in backyards across the country, affording Americans a new housing option. Some communities are not happy about it.

media.copyright: Tojo Andrianarivo for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Parenting;Children and Childhood;Anxiety and Stress;Polls and Public Opinion;Families and Family Life;Mental Health and Disorders;internal-sub-only;Pew Research Center
results.title: How Parenting Today Is Different, and Harder
results.abstract: Parents feel intense pressure to be more hands-on, and a new survey shows this often means more emotional engagement.

media.caption: Nearly half of parents said they were raising their children differently than they had been raised.
media.copyright: Kenny Holston for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Dating and Relationships;internal-sub-only;Lying;Ethics (Personal);Personal Finances
results.title: What Should You Do When Your Partner Lies About His Earnings?
results.abstract: The magazine’s Ethicist columnist on a financial betrayal — and more.

results.adx_keywords: Deaths (Obituaries);Television;Loring, Lisa;Addams, Charles
results.title: Lisa Loring, Wednesday Addams in ‘The Addams Family,’ Dies at 64
results.abstract: With her dark clothes and pigtailed hair framing a pale face, Ms. Loring played Wednesday as a young girl obsessed with death on the ABC series, which ran from 1964 to 1966.

media.caption: Lisa Loring in 2022. “I got it because of my pout,” she once said of the role that made her famous.

results.adx_keywords: Television;Cable Television;Appointments and Executive Changes;Paramount Plus;Showtime
results.title: Showtime Changes Its Name in a Nod to Its Streaming Future
results.abstract: The cable network will be called Paramount+ With Showtime, and its programming will soon be integrated into the Paramount+ streaming app.

media.caption: Showtime, a Paramount subsidiary, canceled “Let the Right One In” and “American Gigolo” on Monday.
media.copyright: Alex Welsh for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Police Brutality, Misconduct and Shootings;Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Emergency Medical Treatment;Police;Nichols, Tyre (d 2023);Police Department (Memphis, Tenn);Memphis (Tenn)
results.byline: By Nicholas Bogel-Burroughs, Gina Kolata and Mark Walker
results.title: Video of Tyre Nichols Beating Raises Questions About Medical Response
results.abstract: Two emergency medical technicians who first evaluated Mr. Nichols have been suspended until an investigation is complete.

media.caption: A memorial for Tyre Nichols at the corner where he was fatally beaten by Memphis police officers.

results.adx_keywords: Automobiles;Used Cars;E-Commerce;Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Shortages;United States Economy;Inflation (Economics);Carmax Inc;Carvana Co
results.title: The Pandemic Used-Car Boom Is Coming to an Abrupt End
results.abstract: Dealership are seeing sales and prices drop as consumers tighten their belts, putting financial pressure on companies, like Carvana, that grew fast in recent years.

media.caption: An empty eight-story Carvana tower in Denver. The company recently reported a quarterly loss of more than $500 million, and has laid off 4,000 employees.
media.copyright: Benjamin Rasmussen for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Drones (Pilotless Planes);Missiles and Missile Defense Systems;International Relations;Mossad;Iran;Israel;Isfahan (Iran)
results.byline: By Ronen Bergman, David E. Sanger and Farnaz Fassihi
results.title: Israel Launched Drone Attack on Iranian Facility, Officials Say
results.abstract: While the target’s purpose is unclear, the city of Isfahan is a major center of Iranian missile production, research and development.

media.caption: A video capturing what is said to be the moment a drone hit a military factory in Isfahan, Iran.
media.copyright: West Asia News Agency, via Reuters

results.adx_keywords: Ovens and Stoves;Greenhouse Gas Emissions;Air Pollution;Hazardous and Toxic Substances;Asthma;Regulation and Deregulation of Industry;Research;Conflicts of Interest;Goodman, Julie E;American Gas Assn;American Medical Assn;American Petroleum Institute;Consumer Product Safety Commission;Rocky Mountain Institute (RMI);Oregon
results.title: In the Fight Over Gas Stoves, Meet the Industry’s Go-To Scientist
results.abstract: Longstanding research shows the health dangers of gas-burning ranges. Utilities are turning to Julie Goodman, a toxicologist with a firm whose work raises questions about the science.

media.caption: Dr. Goodman in an image from a 2021 video of a community meeting in Massachusetts regarding health concerns related to a fireworks facility.
